responses: Hello there!
Good to see you!
Hi there, how can I help you?
Hope to talk to you again!
Chat to you later!
Goodbye!
You can call me GAB!
I'm Give-A-Bot!
I'm GAB which stands for Give-A-Bot.

Give A Lot strives for the utmost security and honesty with our users, we ensure that the organisations presented on our app have been vetted and verified by our moderators. Only organisations past level 1 will be displayed on our application, however as a rule of thumb, the higher the organisations level, the more trustworthy they are, with level 0 being untrustworthy and level 5 being fully verified. 
(For more information about levels, please ask about certificate levels)

patterns: why was give a lot created
tell me about what you do
what does give a lot do
responses: Give A Lot was founded in 2021 by Deepsink Partners, with the idea and hope of allowing people to easily find verified organisations, who they can support and/or donate to.

patterns: how is give a lot run
who can work for give a lot
can i work for give a lot
do you have a job for me
responses: Give A Lot is a non-profit platform, with minimal staff in charge of verifying organisations, though we hope to expand in the future! You can send us an email if you want to help moderate the platform.

patterns: How do I donate to a charity with Give A Lot
what do i need to do to donate to an organisation
responses: You can donate using your PayPal account, by pressing the donate button on an organisations page, or scanning their QR code

patterns: does the money go straight to the charity
does the donation go to the organisation directly
responses: When you donate, all proceeds are sent directly to the organisation. Please make sure you have chosen the correct organisation and that it satisfies your requirements before donating, since donations are final and Give A Lot has no control over a sent donation.

patterns: can i donate more than once a month
do you get paid a commission
responses: When donating you will have the option to set up monthly recurring donations.
The Paypal integration allows you to have once-off donations, as well as monthly recurring donations.

patterns: does give a lot receive any money
does give a lot take a percentage
does all the money go to the organisation
responses: Thanks to the PayPal integration, all proceeds of the donation will be sent directly to the organisation you donated to!
Give A Lot does not take any percentage of a donation, the full donation goes to the organisation.

patterns: can i only donate using paypal
why does give a lot use paypal
responses: With PayPal, it allows us to not act as a middle-man between organisations and donors. We do not have access to donations made.

patterns: how to i setup a donation account
where do i get a paypal link
do not have a qr code
how do i generate a donation link
responses:
As an organisation, at level 3 you will be required to provide information so that you can accept donations. Please follow our donation setup tutorial on how to setup your PayPal donation link. 
(link)

patterns: give a lot rejected my provided donation information
responses:
If your PayPal information was rejected, please make sure your followed the correct steps. A full tutorial is provided here. 
(link)

patterns: what are the give a lot certificates
what are the point of certificates
responses: The Give A Lot issued certificates represent the level of authenticity of an organisation. The more information an organisation provides to prove their legitimacy, the higher level their certificate will be.

patterns: how does an organisation get validated
how does an organisation get approved
how does an organisation get a certificate
responses:
When an organisation is first registered with Give A lot, they are issued a level 0 certificate. This unique certificate is then uploaded onto the blockchain, where only Give A Lot can access it. When an organisation wants to improve their level, they are required to provide certain information that will be validated and used by the Give A Lot moderators to determine whether the organisation meets the requirements to satisfy an upgrade. If they satisfy the requirements, their space on the blockchain will be updated with their new certificate. 
(For more information ask about certificate verification)

patterns: how do you know a certificate is authentic
responses:
If you have received a Give A lot certificate from a registered organisation, you can upload it to see whether it is authentic or not! Once uploaded our system will confirm that the provided certificate matches the non-tampered certificate on the blockchain. If you redirected to that organisations page it is authentic! 
(If the certificate you received does not redirect you, please ask me about Invalid Certificates)

patterns: the certificate has been tampered with
i uploaded a certificate and i got an error
the certificate given to me doesn't work
responses:
When you upload a certificate and we inform you it is invalid, it can be caused by a plethora of reasons. 
 1. The pdf file you provided wasn't actually a certificate. Please make sure the file you upload is (what looks-like) a Give A lot certificate. 
 2. The certificate is outdated. Please make sure that the certificate you possess is up to date, an organisations level can change over time, so the certificate may be outdated. 
 3. The certificate has been tampered with. It is possible that the certificate you received has been tampered with, please examine the certificate for any anomalies, and submit a report if any were found. 
 4. The certificate is forged. It is possible that the certificate you received was forged by an unknown party, please look for any irregularities on the certificate and submit a report if any were found.

patterns: how long does a certificate last
how long is a certificate valid for
responses: Give A Lot issued certificates are only valid for a year, after which the certificate expires and the organisation must renew it. A certificate can also expire if the level of an organisation changes, however the certificate will be replaces by a new one.

patterns: how can i get a certificate
where do i download a certificate
responses: You can download a certificate for a specific organisation from the page on the Give A Lot application, just search for their name, select the appropriate organisation and you will be presented the option to download that organisations certificate.

patterns: can i trust a level 1 2 3 4 5 organisation
responses:
There are 6 certificate levels an organisation can be: 
 Level 0: A newly created organisation which has only provided fundamental information, it is extremely untrustworthy, as such it will not be show when browsing and it cannot accept donations. 
 Level 1: An organisation which has provided enough information to be displayed on the Give A Lot App and is government registered. It is still untrustworthy and cannot accept donations. 
 Level 2: An organisation that has proved it physically and virtually exists, it has been validated to an extent but still cannot accept donations. 
 Level 3: An organisation which has qualified to receive donations and has become established on the app. 
 Level 4: An organisation which has had it's governing body verified and has provided their social media presence. 
 Level 5: An organisation which has been fully verified and provided proof that they have been audited, the most trustworthy organisation.

patterns: how do i report an organisation
how do i submit a report
when should i submit a report
responses:
If you have identified an organisation that has presented false information on their page or they have been found guilty of fraud, please submit a report to give us notice of this. 
 To submit a report, find the organisation that is guilty, open their page and press the report button. You will be prompted to identify the type of report and provide a brief description of the offence.

patterns: how can i contact an organisation
i want to speak to a charity
i want to discuss with this organisation
responses: If you have any questions you want to ask a registered organisation, you can make use of the Give A Lot chat app as well as contact them via their provided email or social media accounts on their organisation page.

patterns: how do i reset my password
responses: If you would like to change your password, go to your account portal and choose the change password option.

patterns: how can i renew my certificate
responses: If your certificate needs to be renewed, go to your organisation portal and navigate to the certificate tab, the option to renew your certificate will be there. Renewing a certificate is not instantaneous because an moderator will have to confirm the renewal before it will take effect.

patterns: do i have to provide all information to move onto the next level
i don't want to give this information
responses: As an organisation, all information needed to move onto the next certificate level is required, there are no exceptions.

patterns: we do not have a facebook instagram twitter account
is it required to have a social media account
responses: In order to move to certificate level 4, you are required to have a social media presence on at least 2 of the 3 supported social media platforms: Facebook, Instagram or Twitter.

patterns: i have to resubmit these details
why did this info get denied
can't move to the next level
responses: As an organisation, if your provided details for a certificate level were denied, please access what you provided and that it conforms to our guidelines for that specific information.

patterns: what can i do with my certificate
how do we use the certificate
what is the purpose of the certificate
responses: Once you have your certificate, you can distribute it and use it to show your authenticity. People can then use the Give A Lot app to confirm the validity of the certificate.

patterns: how do i register an organisation
how do i sign up on the system

responses: Baby don't hurt me
